column3:
Eshana has a task for a helpful adventurer.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Throw the acrid-smelling powder on signal fires.
Are you feeling helpful, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? The hour has come to call in the patrols, but I cannot leave my ssstation.
I would be grateful if you could head out and throw thisss powder onto our sssignal fires─the sssmoke will let our ssscouts know that fresh patrols are on the way to relieve them.
Here. I'll mark the places on your map where the fires are to be found. A trifling tasssk, I know, but I appreciate your aid nonetheless.
You hear the voice of an alerted scout from the direction of the Velodyna River.

(-Distant Scout-)Ah, finally! I've been aching for a nice cup of tea and <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>a comfortable ssspot to sssit<Else/>a ssspot in the shade</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>a ssspot in the shade<Else/>a comfortable ssspot to sssit</If></If>.
(-Distant Scout-)I hope the next ssscout has more luck tracking that big antlion than I did...
(-Nearby Scout-)Already? My report will be a dull one, but I sssuppose those are the mossst welcome.
(-Nearby Scout-)Time to head back. I needed to sharpen my blade again in any case.
You hear the beating wings of a griffin approaching from the direction of Virdjala...
You hear the steady clomp of booted feet approaching from the direction of Virdjala...
<cough> Oof, that stuff doesn't half make your eyes water. Thanks for the signal!
Thank you. Our patrols range far and wide out here on the border, and lines of communication can be difficult to maintain.
Griffins fly ssswiftly, of courssse, but a sssignal fire does the job even fassster. Even if the sssmoke does reek like a pile of marid...ahem, well it cannot be helped.
If you don't mind ssstretching your legs, I could probably use your help the next time we call in the ssscouts.
